title: Raymond 2014 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: A tightly wound framework of bittersweet tannin and oak dominate in this mountainous red, which exhibits pencil shavings, cedar and sage around ripe full-bodied black cherry and plum.

title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Quinta do Síbio Arinto (Douro)
description: Grown in the comparatively cool conditions of the plateau of Alijó, this wine has a crisp, poised character. Its citrus fruits and touch of minerality give freshness and a good texture. Drink this bright wine now.

title: Reyes 2013 Ryan's Blend Red (California)
description: Black fruit, dark lilacs and wet earth show on the nose of this blend of 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Merlot and 24% Petit Verdot. Elderflower and elderberry flavors show on the sip, which is tight and sticky in texture and could use a little more mellowing.

title: Rivera 2016 Terre Al Monte Sauvignon (Castel del Monte)
description: Restrained and earthy, this Sauvignon displays citrus peel and crushed stone aromas. The palate offers a bit more intensity and complexity, with grapefruit zest creating a focused line of acidity from start to finish.

title: San Marzano 2013 Sessantanni Old Vines  (Primitivo di Manduria)
description: There's a density to the nose and palate that can't be ignored, which translates to a syrupy aroma and thick palate. There are some uplifting tones of herbs and savory cherry that offer levity, with brisk acidity and bolstering tannins giving support.

title: Schmidt 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Applegate Valley)
description: Pure varietal and estate grown, this opens with concentrated, sweet berry preserves of strawberry and raspberry jam. It stiffens up in the middle as it moves into rather astringent, lightly earthy tannins.

title: Schmidt 2014 Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)
description: Despite the high alcohol, this is relatively restrained, with flavors mixing rosewater and raspberries. It's a simple, lightly fruity wine, with stiff tannins that introduce suggestions of black tea and a whiff of tobacco.

title: Seacampo 2014 Casa Américo Red (Dão)
description: This ripe wine, with its rich tannins and smooth texture, is delicious. Balanced and soft, it's a ripe blend of Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Jaen. With blackberry and black-currant flavors, it is fruity. It has no wood aging, although there's some final spice from the fruit. Drink now.

title: The Four Graces 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This young wine is quite tight and tannic, with hard fruit flavors of red currant. Stemmy scents and flavors are out in full force, and this might well want another year or two in bottle before it's all pulled together. There's a finishing lick of ultra dark chocolate threaded through those chewy tannins.

title: Topiary 2015 Shiraz (Franschhoek)
description: This is a straightforward yet not overly expressive Shiraz, with subtle notes of currant and plum skin on the nose and mouth. The structure is easy and approachable, with soft tannins and fruit-skin flavors that lend subtle grip through the licorice-laced finish. Drink now.

title: Valenciso 2016 Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
description: Briny apple aromas with woody notes open this barrel-fermented Viura. In the mouth, this shows good acidity and a fairly full body. Salty, lightly oxidized apple flavors finish round, with lingering salty barrel notes.

title: Villa 2013 Mon Satèn Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of yellow fruit, chamomile and a whiff of toasted nut lead the nose. The vibrant palate shows Golden Delicious apple, yellow Anjou pear and bread crust set against a lively perlage. It closes on a bitter walnut note.

title: Watermill 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The oak is far out front, with aromas of vanilla, shaved coconut, toast and freshly chopped wood, making it hard to get at the notes of dark fruit and herb. The flavors show fruit mixed with a heavy barrel influence, with the latter winning out on the finish.

title: Whitehall Lane 2015 Tre Leoni Red (Napa Valley)
description: This affordable blend combines Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Zinfandel. Elusive and thick in concentrated black fruit and leather, it offers massive, assertive tannins and a lasting imprint of dried herb.

title: Whitetail Ridge 2015 Rosé (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is a straight-ahead, electric red, slightly off-dry rosé, made from Pinot Noir grapes. Red fruits with a spicy kick have plenty of fruit sweetness, though not necessarily residual sugar. Given that it's a 2015, it should be consumed as soon as possible.

title: Willm 2016 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The nose wants to give almost nothing away. The palate, however, presents subtle green pear and yellow plum on a very slender, dry body.

title: Fattoria Del Cerro 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Fruity aromas of wild red berry and a whiff of moist soil lift out of the glass. On the restrained light-bodied palate, bright acidity and dusty, not very persistent tannins give sheer support to red cherry and a hint of white pepper. Drink soon.

title: A Mano 2016 Imprint Susumaniello (Salento)
description: This rare native grape creates a wine that is enjoyable in primary fruit expression. Floral and spicy, with a wealth of red cherry and black berry flavors, this is light bodied but crisp, clean and perfect with a slight chill.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Vidgueira 2016 Bilontra Red (Alentejo)
description: Ripe red fruits dominate this soft wine. The fruitiness of Trincadeira is boosted by the firmer character of Alicante Bouschet and Touriga Nacional, yielding a rich wine that is smooth and juicy, with spice and dark-coffee flavors. Drink now.

title: Adega dos Eidos 2012 Contraaparede Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This densely gold-colored Albariño spent three years on its lees. Now it's showing flat aromas of dried apricot and cider. A chunky palate is caught between the now and then, tasting of yeasty melon and dried citrus fruits. It's a mature white wine with offbeat characteristics.

title: Château les Clauzots 2016  Graves
description: Sauvignon Gris may be only 10% of the blend but it gives a delicious perfumed character to this wine. Grapefruit and apricot flavors combine with the mineral texture to give a rich while still taut wine. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château Moulin de Canhaut 2015  Médoc
description: This small 12-acre property has a high proportion of Merlot in its blends. Still packed with high-toast wood flavors, this wine has a future, with plenty of ripe red-berry fruits and a generous texture. Wait for the wood to dissipate and for the fruit to come forward.

title: Château Villefranche 2015  Sauternes
description: This wine is rich with sweetness although it shows only a light botrytis character. It has a touch of spice from the wood aging as well as honey and lemon to balance the sweetness and acidity. Even though young, it is ready to drink.

title: Creekbend 2015 Estate Bottled Crimson Cabernet (Indiana Uplands)
description: Aromas of juicy black plums and raspberries meld with vanilla and sage on the nose. Loaded with flavors of vanilla and baked plums, the palate is plush in feel, with hints of raspberry, white pepper and oregano. Mellow acidity fades into the medium-length finish, showing soft notes of blackberry speckled with pepper.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Reserve Barbera (Paso Robles)
description: In terms of sheer hedonism, this is a successful wine, full of oaky aromas of vanilla cake, caramel and plum pudding, loaded with crème brûlée and ripe fruit flavors. But the oak winds up feeling single-noted by the finish, and the grape seems lost in the seasonings.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Perlat Garnacha (Montsant)
description: Berry and spice aromas that suggest clove open this medium-bodied Garnacha. Spiced berry flavors hint at cinnamon, while chocolate notes are welcome on a plump finish.

title: Château des Tourelles 2015  Médoc
description: This wine shows its wood aging while allowing the red fruits to speak. It has weight, juicy acidity from the Merlot in the blend and a good medium-term future. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Grandis 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This ripe, wood- and fruit-laden wine offers plenty of red-berry flavors. The wood is still prominent although the structure will fill out with the fruit. With a ripe, juicy future the wine will be ready to drink from 2023.

title: Château La Grange de Bessan 2015  Médoc
description: Considerable toast aromas and flavors from wood aging have given this wine a dark-coffee, extracted character. The ripe fruit of the year is developing to balance this and give, over the medium term, a ripe black-currant, Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine. Drink from 2022.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Gigi's Blend Estate Red (Contra Costa County)
description: This medium-bodied, dry and spicy-tasting wine has a relatively light color, aromas like cedar and cinnamon and lean cherry flavors. A definite touch of tannin adds grip to the mouthfeel.
